title: The Roman general Orestes forces western Roman Emperor Julius Nepos to flee his capital city, Ravenna.
text: The Roman general Orestes forces western Roman Emperor Julius Nepos to flee his capital city, Ravenna.

title: Theodoric, king of the Ostrogoths, defeats Odoacer at the Battle of Isonzo, forcing his way into Italy.
text: Theodoric, king of the Ostrogoths, defeats Odoacer at the Battle of Isonzo, forcing his way into Italy.

title: Fatimah, daughter of the Islamic prophet Muhammad died, with her cause of death being a controversial topic among the Sunni Muslims and Shia Muslims.
text: Fatimah, daughter of the Islamic prophet Muhammad died, with her cause of death being a controversial topic among the Sunni Muslims and Shia Muslims.

title: Silla–Tang armies crush the Baekje restoration attempt and force Yamato Japan to withdraw from Korea in the Battle of Baekgang.
text: Silla–Tang armies crush the Baekje restoration attempt and force Yamato Japan to withdraw from Korea in the Battle of Baekgang.

title: Third Crusade: The Crusaders begin the Siege of Acre under Guy of Lusignan.
text: Third Crusade: The Crusaders begin the Siege of Acre under Guy of Lusignan.

title: The Ottoman Turks occupy Belgrade.
text: The Ottoman Turks occupy Belgrade.

title: The Kaqchikel Maya rebel against their former Spanish allies during the Spanish conquest of Guatemala.
text: The Kaqchikel Maya rebel against their former Spanish allies during the Spanish conquest of Guatemala.

title: Turkish–Portuguese War: Battle of Wofla: The Portuguese are scattered, their leader Christovão da Gama is captured and later executed.
text: Turkish–Portuguese War: Battle of Wofla: The Portuguese are scattered, their leader Christovão da Gama is captured and later executed.

title: Pedro Menéndez de Avilés sights land near St. Augustine, Florida and founds the oldest continuously occupied European-established city in the continental United States.
text: Pedro Menéndez de Avilés sights land near St. Augustine, Florida and founds the oldest continuously occupied European-established city in the continental United States.

title: Henry Hudson discovers Delaware Bay.
text: Henry Hudson discovers Delaware Bay.

title: Election of Ferdinand II, Holy Roman Emperor.
text: Election of Ferdinand II, Holy Roman Emperor.

title: Second Bishop's War: King Charles I's English army loses to a Scottish Covenanter force at the Battle of Newburn.
text: Second Bishop's War: King Charles I's English army loses to a Scottish Covenanter force at the Battle of Newburn.

title: The Siege of Colchester ends when Royalists Forces surrender to the Parliamentary Forces after eleven weeks, during the Second English Civil War.
text: The Siege of Colchester ends when Royalists Forces surrender to the Parliamentary Forces after eleven weeks, during the Second English Civil War.

title: Meidingnu Pamheiba is crowned King of Manipur.
text: Meidingnu Pamheiba is crowned King of Manipur.

title: William Herschel discovers a new moon of Saturn: Enceladus.
text: William Herschel discovers a new moon of Saturn: Enceladus.

title: Battle of Grand Port: The French accept the surrender of a British Navy fleet.
text: Battle of Grand Port: The French accept the surrender of a British Navy fleet.

title: The Baltimore and Ohio Railroad's new Tom Thumb steam locomotive races a horse-drawn car, presaging steam's role in U.S. railroads.
text: The Baltimore and Ohio Railroad's new Tom Thumb steam locomotive races a horse-drawn car, presaging steam's role in U.S. railroads.

title: The Slavery Abolition Act 1833 receives royal assent, abolishing slavery through most of the British Empire.
text: The Slavery Abolition Act 1833 receives royal assent, abolishing slavery through most of the British Empire.

title: The first issue of Scientific American magazine is published.
text: The first issue of Scientific American magazine is published.

title: After a month-long siege, Venice, which had declared itself independent as the Republic of San Marco, surrenders to Austria.
text: After a month-long siege, Venice, which had declared itself independent as the Republic of San Marco, surrenders to Austria.

title: The Carrington event is the strongest geomagnetic storm on record to strike the Earth. Electrical telegraph service is widely disrupted.
text: The Carrington event is the strongest geomagnetic storm on record to strike the Earth. Electrical telegraph service is widely disrupted.

title: American Civil War: Union forces attack Cape Hatteras, North Carolina in the Battle of Hatteras Inlet Batteries which lasts for two days.
text: American Civil War: Union forces attack Cape Hatteras, North Carolina in the Battle of Hatteras Inlet Batteries which lasts for two days.

title: American Civil War: Second Battle of Bull Run, also known as the Battle of Second Manassas. The battle ends on August 30.
text: American Civil War: Second Battle of Bull Run, also known as the Battle of Second Manassas. The battle ends on August 30.

title: The United States takes possession of the (at this point unoccupied) Midway Atoll.
text: The United States takes possession of the (at this point unoccupied) Midway Atoll.

title: Cetshwayo, last king of the Zulus, is captured by the British.
text: Cetshwayo, last king of the Zulus, is captured by the British.

title: Caleb Bradham's beverage "Brad's Drink" is renamed "Pepsi-Cola".
text: Caleb Bradham's beverage "Brad's Drink" is renamed "Pepsi-Cola".

title: Silliman University is founded in the Philippines. It is the first American private school in the country.
text: Silliman University is founded in the Philippines. It is the first American private school in the country.

title: A group of mid-level Greek Army officers launches the Goudi coup, seeking wide-ranging reforms.
text: A group of mid-level Greek Army officers launches the Goudi coup, seeking wide-ranging reforms.

title: Queen Wilhelmina opens the Peace Palace in The Hague.
text: Queen Wilhelmina opens the Peace Palace in The Hague.

title: World War I: The Royal Navy defeats the German fleet in the Battle of Heligoland Bight.
text: World War I: The Royal Navy defeats the German fleet in the Battle of Heligoland Bight.

title: World War I: German troops take the city of Namur in Belgium.
text: World War I: German troops take the city of Namur in Belgium.

title: World War I: Germany declares war on Romania.
text: World War I: Germany declares war on Romania.

title: World War I: Italy declares war on Germany.
text: World War I: Italy declares war on Germany.

title: Ten Suffragettes are arrested while picketing the White House.
text: Ten Suffragettes are arrested while picketing the White House.

title: The Georgian opposition stages the August Uprising against the Soviet Union.
text: The Georgian opposition stages the August Uprising against the Soviet Union.

title: France and the Soviet Union sign a treaty of non-aggression.
text: France and the Soviet Union sign a treaty of non-aggression.

title: Toyota Motors becomes an independent company.
text: Toyota Motors becomes an independent company.

title: Denmark in World War II: German authorities demand that Danish authorities crack down on acts of resistance. The next day, martial law is imposed on Denmark.
text: Denmark in World War II: German authorities demand that Danish authorities crack down on acts of resistance. The next day, martial law is imposed on Denmark.

title: World War II: Marseille and Toulon are liberated.
text: World War II: Marseille and Toulon are liberated.

title: Black teenager Emmett Till is brutally murdered in Mississippi, galvanizing the nascent civil rights movement.
text: Black teenager Emmett Till is brutally murdered in Mississippi, galvanizing the nascent civil rights movement.

title: U.S. Senator Strom Thurmond begins a filibuster to prevent the Senate from voting on Civil Rights Act of 1957; he stopped speaking 24 hours and 18 minutes later, the longest filibuster ever conducted by a single Senator.
text: U.S. Senator Strom Thurmond begins a filibuster to prevent the Senate from voting on Civil Rights Act of 1957; he stopped speaking 24 hours and 18 minutes later, the longest filibuster ever conducted by a single Senator.

title: March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom: The Reverend Martin Luther King, Jr. gives his I Have a Dream speech
text: March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom: The Reverend Martin Luther King, Jr. gives his I Have a Dream speech

title: The Philadelphia race riot begins.
text: The Philadelphia race riot begins.

title: Rioting takes place in Chicago during the Democratic National Convention, triggering a brutal police crackdown.
text: Rioting takes place in Chicago during the Democratic National Convention, triggering a brutal police crackdown.

title: Ramstein air show disaster: Three aircraft of the Frecce Tricolori demonstration team collide and the wreckage falls into the crowd. Seventy-five are killed and 346 seriously injured.
text: Ramstein air show disaster: Three aircraft of the Frecce Tricolori demonstration team collide and the wreckage falls into the crowd. Seventy-five are killed and 346 seriously injured.

title: Iraq declares Kuwait to be its newest province.
text: Iraq declares Kuwait to be its newest province.

title: An F5 tornado strikes the Illinois cities of Plainfield and Joliet, killing 29 people.

title: The Galileo spacecraft discovers a moon, later named Dactyl, around 243 Ida, the first known asteroid moon.
text: The Galileo spacecraft discovers a moon, later named Dactyl, around 243 Ida, the first known asteroid moon.

title: Pakistan's National Assembly passes a constitutional amendment to make the "Qur'an and Sunnah" the "supreme law" but the bill is defeated in the Senate.
text: Pakistan's National Assembly passes a constitutional amendment to make the "Qur'an and Sunnah" the "supreme law" but the bill is defeated in the Senate.

title: Second Congo War: Loyalist troops backed by Angolan and Zimbabwean forces repulse the RCD and Rwandan offensive on Kinshasa.

title: In "one of the most complicated and bizarre crimes in the annals of the FBI", Brian Wells dies after becoming involved in a complex plot involving a bank robbery, a scavenger hunt, and a homemade explosive device.[1]
